title: Nicaragua - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: Around 27 January 2021 (between 24 - 30 January), in Leon, Leon, police officers destroyed the security cameras of the headquarters of the Mi Voz Radio station while armed men destroyed the station days later. The radio is known by its opposition to the regime of President Ortega and the attack might be politically motivated. No reports of injuries nor deaths.

On 23 January 2021, in Waslala, Costa Caribe Norte, Mayangna indigenous people protested against impunity and cases of violence against them following a recent attack that left 3 Mayangna indigenous men injured. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2021, in Waslala, Costa Caribe Norte, a group of 30 Mayangna indigenous people were attacked by settlers as part of a land dispute, resulting in three indigenous men injured inside the Bosawas Natural Reserve.

On 22 January 2021, in Bonanza municipality, Costa Caribe Norte, an unknown number of alleged settlers attacked an indigenous territory in the Wilu community on the Sauni As territory. Three persons were injured by shots and various homes were set on fire. No fatalities reported.

On 11 January 2021, in Managua, Managua, two armed men on a moving motorbike shot and killed the brother of the bishop of Granada in the Monsenor Lezcano neighborhood (drive-by). As nothing was stolen, it is believed to be a direct attack.

On 6 January 2021, in Masaya, Masaya, a so-called parapolice officer stopped a journalist from Trinchera Online during a live transmission on school material prices and attacked and injured him with coups. The journalist was taken to a security center, where he was interrogated about his job as a journalist. The journalist has suffered multiple attacks for reporting on issues the government does not want coverage on, such as protests.
Police Forces of Nicaragua (2007-) Prison Guards
On 1 January 2021, in Tipitapa (Managua), a so-called political prisoner was beaten by prison guards according to his relatives. No injuries reported.

On 26 December 2020, in Masaya (Managua), unidentified men on a motorcycle threw a bomb at the house of a journalist and political opponent to the regime of President Ortega. The opponent believes the attack was organized by the local chief of police, although he presented no evidence corroborating this hypothesis. No injuries reported.

On 26 December 2020, in Esteli (Esteli), police officers invaded the house of a political opponent and looted it, as part of a campaign against political dissidence in the country ahead of the 2021 Presidential elections.
UNAB: National Unit Blue and White

Around 24 December 2020 (as reported), at the exit of Managua (Managua), police officers halted a car with members of the National Unit Blue and White and allegedly beat them up before letting them go. No injuries reported.

On 21 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), a university student who was holding a single person picket against the government of President Ortega was arrested and beaten by police forces. A journalist who was filming the situation was threatened by law enforcement.
UNAB: National Unit Blue and White

On 17 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), police officer beat and prevented the leader of UNAB from leaving his house and getting to the airport to catch his flight. Two of his fingers were dislocated due to the attack. Motive is linked to his political views.

On 16 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), a known political opponent to the regime of President Ortega was detained by police officers. While being interrogated, the activist claimed he was beaten by law enforcement.

On 14 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), journalists staged a protest to mark the second anniversary of the police attack against the Confidential newspaper headquarters. Police intervened and pushed protesters to end the event. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), police officers broke and entered the house of a journalist and opponent to the Ortega regime. They attacked and beat him. No reports of serious injuries.

On 9 December 2020, in Puerto Cabezas (Costa Caribe Norte), police beat up and detained a human rights defender and indigenous leader. Motive of detention is unclear but might be politically motivated.

On 6 December 2020, in Wiwili de Jinotega (Jinotega), at the Bosawas Natural Reserve, a Mayangna Indigenous man was killed by unidentified armed men, supposedly due to land-related conflicts between farmers and indigenous groups.

Around 4 December 2020 (as reported), in Juigalpa (Chontales), a political opponent to the regime of Ortega was arrested, taken to a police station where he was beaten up and released four hours later.

On 29 November 2020, in Managua (Managua), a political opponent to the Ortega regime, part of a peasant's union, was approached by four undercover police officers, who detained him and took him to a police station. There, he was reportedly tortured and interrogated by police officers. He was accused of theft and is currently deprived of liberty.

On 27 November 2020, in Chinandega (Chinandega), a councillor of the Citizens for Liberty party, in opposition to the regime of President Ortega, was beaten by several councillors and a vice mayor who are Ortega supporters. No reports of injuries. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, in Puerto Cabezas (Costa Caribe Norte), community members protested against the local government as they need relief following the impact of two storms in the region. [size=no report]
On 29 October 2020, in Managua (Managua), students gathered at a hotel where they protested against the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]

On 26 October 2020, in Wiwili de Jinotega (Jinotega), police officers seized the building of the municipality, not letting employers in. The mayor, a political opponent to the Ortega regime, links the police's actions to an upcoming coup to oust her on fraud claims and replace her with an Ortega supporter. [size=no report]
ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy
On 25 October 2020, on the road towards Masaya (Masaya), police officers stopped and attacked three members of the ACJD, the Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy. No reports of injuries.
UNAB: National Unit Blue and White

On 18 October 2020, in Managua municipality, on the road Masaya - Managua, (Managua), near Cafe Las Flores, around 15 UNAB members, the National Unit Blue and White, protested against the regime of President Ortega. [size=around 15]

On 15 October 2020, in Managua (Managua), students from the University Nicaraguan Alliance protested against the Legislative Assembly approval of cybercrimes law, which hampers freedom of expression. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2020, in Managua (Managua), workers from the Constitutionalist Liberal Party protested in front of the house of the Party leader to demand three months of due salary payments. [size=no report]
Journalists (Nicaragua); UNAB: National Unit Blue and White
On 11 October 2020, in Masaya (Masaya), pro-government militia attacked a journalist and a spokesperson for the UNAB: National Unit Blue and White.

Around 7 October 2020 (as reported), near Managua (Managua), on the road Managua - Masaya, students from the University Alliance protested against the new law proposal on cybercrimes and foreign agents, which can further hamper freedom of expression in the country. [size=no report]
On 4 October 2020 , in Managua (Managua), family members of political prisoners protested in front of the Holiday Inn, demanding their release [size=no report]

On 2 October 2020 , in Tipitapa (Managua), three political prisoners of the Nacional Jorge Navarro penitentiary sewed their mouths in protest against psychological tortures and death threats. Moreover, 54 prisoners also started a hunger strike. [size=no report]

On 26 September 2020, in Diriamba (Carazo), police officers blocked the entrance of a hotel where members of the National Coalition were supposed to have a political meeting. Police did not allow them to check-in and followed them on the road until Managua.

On 26 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), around 30 members of the National Coalition were detained by police forces. These detention appear to be politically motivated, as they target the opposition across the country. Amid them, five opposition leaders from different organizations have been detained.

On 25 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), police forces besieged around the NGO Movement of Working and Unemployed Women Maria Elena Cuadra and forced its members to remain inside. The action seems to be politically motivated as members of the NGO have positioned themselves against the regime of President Ortega. That day, similar facts were reported in front of the feminist NGO La Corriente.
On 23 September 2020, in Masaya (Masaya), rioters burned tires at the entrance of the city and painted political messages in opposition to the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]

On 19 September 2020 (as reported), in Managua (Managua), during the weekend, police members forced a political opponent to the regime of President Ortega and his family members to remain inside their houses, not allowing them to leave to work.
ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy

Around 18 September 2020 (as reported), in an undisclosed location in Nicaragua, police officers found a safe house of the ACJD, the Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy. When members of the group noticed the police presence, they tried to leave the house. Police impeded members from leaving the house and held them there.

On 16 September 2020, in Leon (Leon), at the Sutiaba neighborhood, armed pro-government militants attacked a man, in an attack which might be connected to the victim's political activities against the regime of President Ortega. No injuries nor fatalities reported.

On 16 September 2020, in Leon (Leon), armed pro-government militants attacked the house of the family of a political opponent to the Ortega regime, throwing rocks at the house and insulting the two women who remained inside. No injuries nor fatalities reported.

On 13 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), family members of political prisoners and members of the National Coalition, protested in front of the Holiday Inn Hotel demanding the release of political prisoners. Over eight patrols arrived at the protest, but no further intervention was reported. [size=no report]

On 13 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), a feminist group of around 20 people protested against femicides and gender-based violence in different area of the city. Police quickly intervened and relocated the group on the road to Masaya. There, another police intervention was reported where one protester was injured and five other were detained for 20 minutes. [size=around 20]

On 12 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), the General Direction of Revenues embargoed Canal 12 (Channel 12) for improper tax statements. However, hidden motive might be connected to political antagonism between the visions aired at the channel and the regime of President Ortega.

On 10 September 2020, in Puerto Cabezas municipality (Costa Caribe Norte), at the Kukasquiamp territory, a Miskito man was shot and injured, supposedly by a militia of farmers. Motive might be linked to revenge for the recent death of a farmer under unclear circumstances.
On 28 August 2020, in Managua (Managua), community members protested against the closure of an orphanage following the suicide of a child there. [size=no report]

On 18 August 2020, in Bluefields (Costa Caribe Sur), indigenous communities protested to demand free regional elections in the country in accordance to their right of self-determination. [size=no report]
On 8 August 2020, in Managua (Managua), family members of political prisoners protested demanding their release. [size=no report]
On 5 August 2020, in La Concepcion (Masaya), a catholic religious political opponent to the regime of President Ortega was killed. Motive might be robbery or might be connected to political reasons.

On 31 July 2020, in Managua (Managua), an unidentified man threw an explosive and destroyed a Christian image in the Managua's Cathedral. Two persons were inside, but were not injured. Motive and perpetrator unknown.

Around 31 July 2020 (as reported), in Managua (Managua), members of a Christian group triggered a riot and started to fight with another group after they thought an iconic image was being stolen during a religious ceremony. There has been recent tensions caused by an earlier attack against a Christian cathedral in Managua the same day. [size=no report]

On 10 July 2020, near Rosita (Costa Caribe Norte), a Mayangna Indigenous man was killed and another injured at the Bosawas reserve, supposedly during an attack by a group of settlers. Perpetrators are unknown.

On 9 July 2020, in Waslala (Costa Caribe Norte), a renowned Sandinista militant was shot and killed by two men on a motorcycle during a drive-by shooting. Motive might be linked to his political opposition to the Ortega regime. Perpetrators are unknown.
On 20 June 2020, in Leon (Leon), the house of a political opposer formerly incarcerated was attacked by police with stones. No injuries nor deaths reported.

Around 19 June 2020, in Bluefields (Costa Caribe Sur), family members of Nicaraguan cruise workers, who stranded at a cruise ship in Barbados, protested to demand the government to let them enter the country. [size=no report]

On 19 June 2020, in Jinotepe (Carazo), unknown conducted a drive-by shooting at the house of two former political prisoners. The victims suspect that it were pro-government people, as they had received threats before. No injuries reported.
Police Forces of Nicaragua (2006-) Prison Guards
On 28 May 2020, in Tipitapa (Managua), one of the so-called political prisoner was attacked and injured by at least one police guard while under detention.

On 27 May 2020, at the border of Nicaragua and Costa Rica, at an unspecified location, truck drivers blocked the route to Costa Rica to protest Costa Rica's decree forbidding the transit of foreign drivers to avoid the spread of the coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 20 May 2020, in Mozonte (Nueva Segovia), around 30 farmers protested against deforestation at the Serranillas de Dipilto Environmental Reserve. [size=around 30]

As reported on 25 April 2020, in Diriamba (Carazo), over a hundred persons joined the funeral of a transgender woman and political opposer to the Nicaraguan political regime. She was beaten and severely injured under custody and did not survive after being released. The funeral turned into a protest with participants shouting against the regime of President Ortega. [size=over a hundred]

Around 20 April 2020 (as reported), in Esquipulas (Matagalpa), a farmer and opponent to the regime of President Ortega was severely beaten and arrested by police forces. Months later in August, he underwent a surgery for a head trauma. It is unclear whether the trauma was caused by police forces during his arrest or during his detention. He was released and handed to his family in December in a paraplegic state as a consequence of his head trauma.

On 20 April 2020, in Esquipulas, Rivas department, a group of persons rioted against police officers, demanding the release of three persons who had been detained. The clash left three officers injured and five civilians were detained. [size=no report]
On 19 April 2020, in Masatepe (Masaya), a man was attacked and injured by an armed group of Ortega supporters before being detained by the police.

As reported on 19 April 2020, in Leon (Leon), a group of Ortega supporters attacked the house of a family of Ortega opposers. They broke the windows but no injuries have been reported. [size=no report]

In between the night of 19 April 2020 and dawn of 20 April 2020 in Esquipulas, Rivas department, a group of persons, including peasants, celebrated the 2nd anniversary of the 2018 Nicaraguan demonstrations by raising the opposition's blue and white flag at a park. The police reacted with gunfire and the demonstrators reportedly responded with throwing stones. At least three rioters are reportedly injured and 5-8 participants have been detained. [size=no report]

On 18 April 2020, in San Carlos (Rio San Juan), a leader of the peasant movement as well as an opposer to the regime of President Ortega was killed at the community of Los Chiles under so far unclear circumstances. The killing is likely to be motivated by his political leanings.
On 17 April 2020 in Mozonte (Nueva Segovia), six police officers attacked, injured and detained a man. They also supposedly robbed his money. He was released the next day and motive is unclear.

On 17 April 2020, in Masaya (Masaya) two bombs exploded at the second anniversary of the April protests which took thousands to the streets in April 2018 against the regime of President Ortega. No reported deaths nor injuries.

On 16 April 2020, in Niquinohomo (Masaya), Ortega supporters attacked and injured the father of a journalist who opposes the regime of President Ortega. The journalist had been receiving threats. The victim is recovering at a hospital.

As reported on 1 April 2020, in Wiwili de Jinotega (Jinotega), a former member of the Nicaraguan Resistance, was found dead, with signs of torture, at the local headquarters of the FSLN: Sandinista National Liberation Front party. Motive is linked to his opposition to the regime of President Ortega.

On 27 March 2020, in Rosita (Costa Caribe Norte), peasants invaded the house of a family at the Ibu community, at the Marcial Washington farm, and killed a mother, her son and another man. Motive is related to land-grabbing issues. All the victims were from the Mayangna Indigenous Group living at the Tuakha territory. One report quotes the police stating there were four fatalities, that one of the perpetrators died, however this was not confimed in other reports. 3 fatalities.

On 26 March 2020, in Rosita (Costa Caribe Norte), peasants invaded the Wasakin community, Tuahka territory, and killed three men and injured at least two other. Motive is related to land-grabbing issues, which have been mounting in Nicaragua. All the victims were from the Mayangna Indigenous Group and one of the killed persons was the vice syndic of Wasakin. 3 fatalities.
On 22 March 2020, in Wiwili de Jinotega (Jinotega), the leader of the PLC in the municipality of Wiwili de Jinotega has been shot and killed in a drive-by shooting.

On 15 March 2020, in San Juan de Nicaragua (Rio San Juan), a peasant who had been detained by the police the previous day was released with signs of violence around his body, with both ribs and a hand broken. The organized peasant movement is in opposition to the Ortega regime and has suffered several attacks and threats due to their political opinion. The peasant is under recovery.
UNAB: National Unit Blue and White; Women (Nicaragua)

On 14 March 2020, in Leon (Leon), the house of a female leader of the UNAB, National Unit Blue and White, was attacked at night by a group called Los Cadejos. It Is unclear whether the leader was inside, but the attackers had machetes and axes with which they tried to take the gate down to invade the house. There are no reports of injuries nor deaths.

On 14 March 2020, in Managua (Managua), a pro-government march called upon by President Ortega and Vice President Murillo took place. The march was themed 'love in times of coronavirus' and was intended to show support and solidarity towards the countries affected by the virus. [size=no report]

On 9 March 2020 in Managua (Managua), over a hundred women covered their faces to protest against gender-based violence inside campus of the Centro-American University, especially femicides, sexual violence against girls and widespread impunity for these crimes, in a protest related to the International Women's Day. [size=over 100]

On 8 March 2020 in Managua (Managua), over two hundred women, among them women human rights defenders, mothers of the protesters killed during the April Protests and representatives of women's organizations, gathered at the women's organization La Corriente. While the women protested inside the grounds of the organization, chanting against the State's oppression and the undue restrictions on freedom of reunion and expression, the police blocked them and impeded the march to take place, including by pushing and aggressing women. A representative from the Permanent Commission on Human Rights was also reportedly attacked by the police. After negotiations, the police allowed them to leave in small groups, effectively impeding the march to take place. [size=over 200]
On 8 March 2020 in Masaya (Masaya), women blocked the road towards Masaya, chanting for justice for a couple of minutes until police arrived and dispersed them. [size=no report]
Women (Nicaragua); UNAB: National Unit Blue and White
On 8 March 2020 in Managua (Managua), women from the UNAB, National Unit Blue and White, made an express protest for a couple of minutes with chants, near the movistar store. [size=over 200]

On 6 March 2020, in San Juan de Nicaragua (Rio San Juan), an unidentified group of armed men attacked the participants in the urn burial of the poet Ernesto Cardenal. He and his circle of close friends opposed the Ortega regime. At the end of the ceremony, Ortega supporters attacked participants and journalists of the burial. Perpetrators unknown.

As reported on 5 March 2020, in Managua (Managua), inside the Permanent Commission on Human Rights, journalists protested the rising repression and acts of violence by the government by gagging themselves and locking their equipment to chains. [size=no report]

As reported on 5 March 2020, in El Sauce (Leon), three unidentified armed men posing as police officers arrived at the farm of a family and tried to forcibly evict them from there. The family reportedly has property titles and refused to leave. The event might be connected to land-grabbing, which has been intensifying around the country.

On 5 March 2020, in Niquinohomo (Masaya), an unidentified group attacked the house of a political activist and feminist with rocks, which they threw for around half an hour against the house. She was inside the house with her family at that point. Motive is linked to her opposition to the Ortega regime and perpetrators are unknown. [size=no report]

On 3 March 2020, in Managua (Managua), at the Cathedral of Managua, an unidentified group of armed men attacked participants and the journalists at the funeral of the poet Ernesto Cardenal. At least seven journalists were attacked, according to multiple reports. Some of them also reported robberies by the attackers. Ernesto Cardenal opposed the Ortega regime, and many of his close friends are also known opposers to the regime. Perpetrators unknown.

On 2 March 2020, in Masaya (Masaya), tens of Walmart employees protested in front of the Walmart offices accusing management of undertaking a mass layoff that could end the contracts of up to 2500 persons connected to the company. [size=tens]

On 28 February 2020, in Waspan (Costa Caribe Norte), farmers invaded the community of Santa Clara, Wangky Twi Tasba Raya (sub group of Miskito) territory, and shot at the community, without deaths nor injuries reported. Perpetrators unknown.

On 25 February 2020, in Managua (Managua), after a broad coalition was announced by distinct political parties and civil society stakeholders, protesters gathered at Metrocentro mall to protest the regime of President Ortega. Around a hundred police officers mobilized at the mall. There were multiple reports of police officers intervening with the protest inside the mall, pushing protesters to disperse the demonstration. Many protesters were detained for variying periods of time while the protest took place. Also, police attacked journalists covering the protest. An AFP reporter witnessed at least other three journalists being attacked by police forces. [size=no report]

On 25 February 2020, in Managua (Managua), after a broad coalition was announced by distinct political parties and civil society stakeholders, protesters gathered at the Divine Misericordy Church to protest the regime of President Ortega. Police officers intervened at the gathering, attacking protesters to disperse the demonstration. At least one journalist was attacked by police officers, with his mobile phone stolen and his car tires flattened during the attack. [size=no report]
AMA: Mothers of April Association; Catholic Christian Group (Nicaragua); Women (Nicaragua)

On 23 February 2020 in Managua (Managua), at the end of a Christian mass at the Cathedral of Managua, held in honour to the dissidents killed under the regime of President Ortega, the Mothers of April and other protesters demonstrated asking for justice and accountability for these crimes, as well as guarantees of no-repetition. They also demanded the release of the 61 remaining so-called political prisoners. [size=no report].

On 21 February 2020 in Managua (Managua), protesters gathered at the Spain Square to demand justice and freedom and protest against the regime of President Ortega. There are reports in multiple media outlets of police officers attacking some of the protesters. No one is reported injured. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in Tuma-La Dalia (Matagalpa) the son of a councilperson from the opposition political party CxL: Citizens for Freedom was shot at the community of Buenos Aires. The attack was conducted by four unknown perpetrators and motive might be linked to the his father's political opinion. The victim lost his hand and is under recovery.

On 17 February 2020 in Mulukuku (Costa Caribe Norte), a member of the political party CxL: Citizens for Freedom and former member of the Nicaraguan Resistance was shot and killed by three armed men. The crime might be connected to his political views in opposition to the regime of President Ortega. Perpetrators unknown.

On 16 February 2020 in Waspan (Costa Caribe Norte), peasants invaded the community of Santa Clara, Wangky Twi Tasba Raya (sub group of Miskito) territory, and shot and injured a woman. The municipal coordinator of Waspan, following the attack, highlighted the presence of 200 peasants around the indigenous territory, with mounting pressure for violent land-grabbing against the indigenous group. Perpetrators unknown.
ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy

On 10 February 2020, in La Libertad (Chontales), when leaving a political meeting, eight members of the ACJD (Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy), were attacked by unidentified armed men who were shooting from motorcycles and cars against the vehicles of ACJD members. Motive is linked to the victims' opposition to President Ortega's regime. No one is reported injured nor dead.
UNAB: National Unit Blue and White

On 30 January 2020 in Managua (Managua), family members of persons deprived of liberty and the UNAB, the National White and Blue Unity protested in front of Managua's cathedral to demand the release of the so-called political prisoners of Nicaragua. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2020, in Jinotega (Jinotega), inside the Bosawas Biosphere Reserve, the second biggest rainforest at the Americas, at least six Mayangna indigenous persons were killed in an attack perpetrated by approximately eighty settlers, who have also burned down the indigenous communities houses, in an attack motivated by land disputes. Both the UN and the OAS have condemned the attacks and urged the government to investigate and punish the perpetrators. The Mayangna people have been calling attention to their land disputes since 2014, with mounting pressure from settlers to evict them from their lands for farming.

On 27 January 2020 in Chichigalpa (Chinandega), on parallel to the funeral of a young woman killed recently, community members of Chichigalpa marched to demand justice and accountability for the victim. The community members marched until near the funeral, but were stopped from entering it. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2020 in Masaya (Masaya), during a Catholic Christian march, members of the Catholic Christian church protested against the regime of President Ortega and demanded the release of so-called political prisoners. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2020 in Managua (Managua), a police officer attacked a journalist as he was covering an event at a hotel in Managua. The motive is linked to the journalist's opposition to President Ortega's regime.

On 15 January 2020 in La Paz de Carazo (Carazo), at the neighborhood Las Esquinas, two unidentified armed men abducted another men and forcibly marked the word 'plumb' on his skin on his arm and later released him. Perpetrators unknown and motive linked to the victim's opposition to the regime of President Ortega.

On 10th January 2020 in Managua (Managua), at the Central Cementery of Managua, family members of Pedro Joaquin Chomorro, director of the news outlet La Prensa and killed 42 years ago paid honour to their family member. At the opportunity, they also protested against the regime of President Ortega and Vice-President and First Lady Murillo. [size=no report]

On 9th January 2020, in an unclear location not disclosed for his own protection, a man was abducted by reportedly supporters of President Ortega who forcibly tattoed him with the word 'plomo', a word usually used to mark houses of opposers to the regime of President Ortega. It usually means he is targeted to be killed. The attack happened after the man uploaded a picture of the inverted Nicaragua flag on his social media account, a symbol of protest and resistance across Nicaragua. After being tattoed, he was released. Perpetrators unknown.

On 1st January 2020 during a religious march, marchers turned it into a protest by displaying inverted flags of Nicaragua - what has become a symbol of protest and resistance as the democratic space declines swiftly around the country. [size=no report]

On 27th December 2019 in Leon (Leon), 17 rioters arrived on motorcycles and broke the security camera and damaged the installations of Dario Radio. The radio is known for its political opposition against the regime of President Ortega and has suffered other attacks throughout 2019. [size=17]
AMA: Mothers of April Association; Women (Nicaragua)

On 25 December 2019 in Managua (Managua) inside the mall Galerias, protesters, mostly mothers from the Mothers of April Association, demanded the release of so-called political prisoners detained under the regime of President Ortega. Days later, 91 prisoners were in fact released. [size=no report]

On 24th December 2019 in Chinandega (Chinandega), at the street La Sanidad, around fifteen Orteguista supporters and armed paramilitaries attacked two brothers of recently released so-called political prisoner Amaya Coppens and two other people following the victims participation in a protest to release political prisoners. After the attack the aggressors took the four of them to a police station, where they were later released four hours later.
On 24th December 2019 in Chinandega (Chinandega), protesters demanded the release of political prisoners at the city's park. [size=no report]

On 23th December 2019 in San Juan de Nicaragua (Rio San Juan) at the community El Fajardo, peasants marched to celebrate six years of their struggle against the Law of the Inter-ocean channel, as well as to demand freedom to the so-called political prisoners of the President Ortega's regime, and to end Ortega's regime. [size=no report]
ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy; UNAB: National Unit Blue and White; Civilians (Nicaragua); Journalists (Nicaragua)

On 12 December 2019 in Managua (capital) at the entrance of the Metrocentro Intercontinental Hotel, members from ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy and UNAB: National Unit Blue and White, besides mothers of so-called political prisoners gathered after a presentation on proposals for election reforms in an improptu protest. Police forces intervened, at least two women were hit by the police with batons. Also a journalist was beaten by three police officers. [size=no report]

As reported on 10 December 2019 in Masaya (Masaya), police officers beat a civilian who is a renowned for their political opposition to the regime of President Ortega. They also stole his telephone, wallet and money. He was riding on a motorcycle when police officers stopped him and said he was going to pay for the trouble political oppositors were causing, before the aggression started.

On 5 December 2019 in Matagalpa (Matagalpa) reportedly a police officer attacked a journalist covering a trial on the murder of a United States' citizen killed in September 2019 in Matagalpa. The police officer broke the journalist's mobile phone. The media channel for which the journalist works for is known for its opposition to the regime of President Ortega, what might be linked to the attack.

On 3 December 2019 in Managua, leaving from the El Nuevo Chipote penitentiary center at the neighborhood of La Loma de Tiscapa, family members of a so-called Belgian political prisoner from the regime of President Ortega denounced an attack from a police officer against her as reported by fellow inmates, as well as her deprivation from needed medicines.

On 2 December 2019 in Masaya (Masaya) the funeral of Jose Ugarte Lopez, alias Chabelo, became a demonstration against the regime of President Ortega, as the regime is accused for his death. Although police officers claim the victim was killed during an armed clash, the victim's wife denies it and links his death to his political engagement in protests against the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]
On 30 November 2019 in Masaya (Masaya), family members of so-called political prisoners protested to demand their immediate release. [size=no report]

On 28 November 2019 in Managua (capital) at the Agrarian University, students protested against the student elections that deemed not to be transparent. They also protested against police harassment. [size=no report]
On 28 November 2019 in Managua (capital) at the Centroamerican University, students protested against the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2019 in Managua (capital) in front of the San Francisco de Asis church, family members of the so-called political prisoners protested against the regime of President Ortega, as well as demanded the release of these prisoners. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2019, in Managua, a student murdered during the demonstrations of April 2018 against Presidente Ortega was honoured by his school and colleagues during their graduation party. Supporters of the Ortega regime approached, screamed and threw objects against the participants of high school graduation. [size=no report]
On 23 November 2019 in Masatepe (Masaya), protesters marched for national peace and in support of the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]
On 23 November 2019 in Managua, protesters marched for national peace and in support of the regime of President Ortega. [size=no report]

On 22th November 2019, in Masaya, a New York Times journalist was attacked by rioters as she was covering a hunger strike going on inside a Catholic church that turned into a siege with police cutting off supplies or people into it. She declared the attacks came by supporters of the regime of President Ortega, and that police did nothing to protect her. [size=no report]

On 21 November 2019 in Managua, inside the Thomas Moore University, students protested against the regime of President Ortega and demanded freedom for the so-called political prisoners of the regime. [size=no report]
